headline: Strong market debuts raise questions over cautious IPO pricing by Wall St banks
summary: (Reuters) -Big first-day gains by recent high-profile U.S. listings have raised questions over whether Wall Street banks — wary of volatility and economic uncertainty from sweeping U.S. tariffs — are pricing them too cautiously, benefiting investors but causing issuers to miss out.  This route was taken by streaming platform Spotify and crypto exchange Coinbase in recent years.

headline: CME Group and FanDuel Join Forces to Let Investors Bet on Financial Market Outcomes
summary: Flutter Entertainment’s online gambling division FanDuel is joining forces with derivatives exchange CME Group Inc to offer wagers on a range of financial market outcomes, from predictions on the S&P 500 to cryptocurrencies.

headline: FanDuel Teams Up With CME for Bets on Stocks and Commodities
summary: Expected to launch later this year, the event-based contracts will be tied to benchmarks such as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100, the prices of oil and gas, gold, cryptocurrencies, and key economic indicators such as GDP and CPI, the companies said Wednesday.  “Interest in prediction markets is growing, driven by unregulated platforms’ volume and signs of a more relaxed regulatory environment,” said Caroline Mauron, co-founder of Orbit Markets.
